CE1BDC1FA33A4528A34629FC119976F3.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer. Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

01D5BF967F1E4C96BBC85442CD513833.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

58902DA950C945198813040EDE1645DE.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals

1C73D8B9D7724F6F8BE4D5C6B76AD787.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

DEF4962EF1F144EB96A8FE43918E3FB5.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

8577D9E6E3AB4E4CBA9CDE324C35A582.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

57FA9A925A6B41F8A6239FBCF872982C.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

C7A188C7B0A84478B89013A3D009D4C5.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

3D609BA42B844B91B3493447C69F4FF2.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

5F75F49B546A426398E8F9FC0380C27C.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

53516A7CE0794FF98B36A310D16BBCCF.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

26BD683810E7471A902D8C1FC0736BEE.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

D76A5F6A47C144CBBDB01E52EDB0C961.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear?, Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

6D2028AF650A4359A25DBDC1F7E38F94.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

C40792673AFF480E9D2A83CE326376D0.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

0B70C96D41B642A9A9DE46D0B0003611.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

77B3FB84E1474AEF8374B4D3C469810E.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

362C9D1BABBA4B26B9DEE244459C30F1.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

462A79431B0A47E997BCB10915851E7D.description: Inquire into issues of gender equity and diversity in the robotics and automation workplace, considering questions such as "Who is typically underrepresented in the robotics and automation field and why?" and "What steps could be taken to encourage people from under-represented groups to pursue robotics and automation related careers?"

E978176CCA784B1EA20FD1F3EE53DA34.description: Research and report on post-secondary educational programs leading to careers in robotics and automation, considering factors such as institutions offering relevant programs, industry certifications, courses of study, entrance requirements, length of programs and costs.

7FB313C421BE4D84A544880ADE7EBACB.description: Identify and report on opportunities for experiential learning (e.g., co-op programs, job shadowing and career fairs) in the field of robotics and automation.

FD472CDDC0EA4859BE8CBBC08016D635.description: Research the education requirements of various career paths and identify those that align with personal lifestyle goals.

0D8AD183927C47439B78D21C0B721595.description: Examine the skills necessary to pursue robotics and/or automation related career paths.

646BB6CF83E34E3EBFDFEFC7B6B8EF8B.description: Careers in Robotics and Automation B (Core)

937F1B9BE8414AB7AFE5F424FB25978C.description: Demonstrate increasingly proficient fabrication techniques, work skills, and presentation skills.

FF75052A89894A62B6AA0E4B21057ADF.description: Assemble and present a project utilizing skills in planning and management as outlined in Module 67A: Introductory Project.

EDEE0F0F712343C5A205BD0EE00CDDA6.description: Construct an intermediate level assigned or approved robotics or automation project.

C129DC24546045D09F14CD229763999F.description: Reflect on a completed project plan and summarize suggestions for improving a future project plan.

B10412BCBA1147B4B72F93BD413AABFC.description: Apply a detailed project design including: identifying the tasks necessary to complete a multi-step project; assigning an approximate length of time to each task in a project; and, generating a timeline for task completion.

A2603E0E9243485A9CBB4817F3384868.description: Follow a plan to create a simple 3D object, using 3D CAD or modeling software, that includes: a simple slab or a block; holes in the slab or block; and, protrusions or cuts on the slab or block.

85FCF5322D5A4B3496C25F92173A0770.description: Understand basic design restrictions and limitations (e.g., raft, overhang, support material, infill and density) associated with 3D printing.

77D862D5722C436CA7F4BE107DD44FDC.description: Create representations of 3- dimensional (3D) objects using computer-aided design (CAD) software.

CCB277D4CF2F425EB030D82362548BEA.description: Compare a variety of electrical pathways by constructing simple circuits

4066AE62DA544ABF937FE4EB0039CF91.description: Analyze the differences between parallel and series circuits.

05CA8E3B731847A2AED038F9F4AFAC80.description: Identify safe current and/or voltage values pertaining to personal safety.

ACFC4232BB9C4BC6882B582D1537B601.description: Identify safe current and/or voltage values pertaining to equipment safety.

A2BD11E2AFEA45E5A47CF0D76DF83AE8.description: Inspect all tools and electrical equipment, including extension cords, for hazards before using them.

8E4FA622F14546CAA016BFBBBF108C4D.description: Identify basic electrical hazards in the shop and/or work area.

B7548E891A5C402BA10352CDC1879831.description: Understand the need for circuit protection in an electrical circuit.

EE7AC977D5D24F37AED34FA1BEAC4906.description: Review safety procedures (e.g., inspect equipment for damaged or frayed wires, ensure proper grounding and ensure work area is free from liquids) for working with electrical equipment.

D7EC5D6C5D514AFCBC32D4ABB3E58353.description: Explain the purpose of ventilation in a confined environment when working with electrical devices such as a soldering iron.

8452A98D7A25448FAAA834D5B4149815.description: Demonstrate safe practices when working with electricity and electrical devices.

05712BB122514A84A9B6D091424CFF16.description: Test one’s prototype against end-user generated success criteria and identify areas for improvement.

CBFFFA7F7972400B8CDA9A775338C1AA.description: Collect appropriate feedback from other designers and end users.

2DA9A15513B44E6D9952EABE5F4F230E.description: Develop procedures for seeking critical feedback from other designers and end users.

751A748AD1BB4ECBB6AC114039251F26.description: Identify the type of feedback (e.g., coaching, praise and evaluation) desired from others.

54ADD26E2CC64ED7AD5363AF16198D25.description: Develop measurable success criteria for evaluating a project.

C0EDF382307F400390E381CD278C2A5D.description: Evaluate a prototype using specific criteria.

C42C3BFC97B14A13B89A69E2CE167338.description: Explore potential applications for machine learning and artificial intelligence in robotics and automation.

3E612DD502274F57928F101486803E38.description: Investigate the ways in which machine learning applications make use of different types of datasets (e.g., image data and facial recognition, text data and news article searches, physical data and astronomy).

4FBEE924AA914C28B08A557067D446D9.description: Examine current limitations of artificial intelligence (e.g., machine learning is based on human instructions and data sets, data sets can perpetuate bias, learning must be supervised).

D923E7C38BF94ED8B8AF46065A68FD69.description: Examine the extent to which artificial intelligence can or cannot exceed or replace human ability in regards to certain tasks (e.g., game-playing computers, self-driving cars and personal assistants).

82A54C1FFC1E4DE5A16FA995ED603BEF.description: Discuss the interrelationships between automation, machine learning and artificial intelligence, within the context of robotics and autonomous devices.

06AF6EC5293A4C06A6078C8F7B3A9D2C.description: Analyze how devices with artificial intelligence work differently than controlled or autonomous devices and robots.

9A8363310C014890966749C15A5993CE.description: Discuss how to identify whether a robotic or automated device is considered to have or display artificial intelligence.

1F06AE6FA0064A9CA915F047C74DC7C4.description: Research the evolving understanding of the concept of artificial intelligence.

F5927F7168F345B79F521BE8FAC39C2A.description: Examine applications of artificial intelligence (AI) in robotics and automation.

7159431C5D2241B6AC05E4748D637B6B.description: Explore issues (e.g., human input, mechanical wear, technical programming) arising with automation.

1A10F2954AA34BCEB49DF3A0D5EB6D36.description: Critique the use of automation in our society, including current and potential effects of automation on society and the environment.

6E76854746AC4E909801B40397D254A2.description: Identify the main advantages of automation.

5228DE436D8846C09CF2F1D4BBD11F1F.description: Research the use of automation in a variety of fields, such as retail, healthcare, food services, mining, waste management, industry, manufacturing, logistics, automotive and in the home

A1BFFA70AB3049F7B82B6696D9EF3CDC.description: Investigate the prevalence and societal impacts of automation.

3A13F2D4C70D458EAFD873E0A47F0AC5.description: Debate an issue related to autonomous devices such as the viability of driverless vehicles of varying levels of autonomy on public highways and private worksites.

9212D3B59F7D4F49A0F03956763B359A.description: Evaluate the impact of a specific application of artificial intelligence.

F8FE823E201C4A1D9B6F81C472E4687E.description: Analyze how artificial intelligence can impact robotics and autonomous devices.

68BB69CD84B4433791E220D00E89FD8A.description: Assess potential positive and negative impacts of robotics on various industries (e.g., automotive manufacturing, agriculture and mining).

9E6AFC8B832042688D4A82FA88CA3AEE.description: Explore societal implications of the increasing prevalence of robotic and autonomous devices in our daily lives and routines.

B0B011E99D0F4B50A6AAC8A1F3D021EF.description: Analyze how movies (e.g., “I, Robot” and “Short Circuit”) about robots portray the effects of robot interaction on humanity and the role of work in the future.

C86E0F1AC8B04B82AD584CF216F43F5D.description: Explore the uses of robotics in the field of medicine for applications such as surgery, rehabilitation and remote diagnosis.

F108BF1D4A0048D8968B7DA6572A9C15.description: Evaluate historical and contemporary impacts of robotics and autonomous devices on society.

42A6A3163881425AB6134D0226583E88.description: Discuss moral implications (e.g., racial profiling, choosing who lives or dies, unemployment and robot rights, the Trolley problem and unintended consequences) related to artificially intelligent robotic and autonomous devices.

B31715B1E0864AED90990B13A096BE71.description: Hypothesize about the possibility that robots or devices with artificial intelligence will be able to make their own decisions and the potential ramifications of this ability

8E362F0BF9A740D089F24A2AAA454358.description: Research current and proposed legislation involving the personal and commercial use of drones.

274950BD664D4511BA6AD4C789973F4E.description: Analyze case studies (e.g., The Case of the Killer Robot by Richard G. Epstein) or news reports of accidents involving death or injury caused by industrial robots and discuss who is considered at fault.

3C45385F6AE04FEE8C38D9C63084FDF5.description: Discuss the theoretical relevance of Asimov’s Laws of Robotics to contemporary applications of robotics and artificial intelligence.

7D0102389FDE4BEEB56C6B34E52B9465.description: Discuss legal and/or ethical perspectives with regards to fault when a robotic or autonomous device causes harm to a person, property or nature.

0AAA70A9F22E4D8E96E8609F7839DB6F.description: Discuss how the ethics of robotic and autonomous devices have been portrayed in the media, particularly in science fiction (e.g., 2001: A Space Odyssey).

E0721FDB1A7645EDA32BD2C0DF3A062D.description: Explore ethical, moral and legal issues relevant to robotics and autonomous devices.

9F011355123E449A87357D65125EC00D.description: Recognize and apply safe and fair work practices including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

807D9F7FA3F64A4AACCD4A0185FCB061.description: Complete an assessment of all safety and robotics equipment and, in consultation with the instructor, perform maintenance to repair or replace defective or worn parts.

6DACF8EF04224CB58D59C8BE885D44BE.description: Practice good housekeeping and avoid obvious hazards (e.g., touching live wires, extending cords over walking spaces and leaving objects on the floor).

63ADEFA5AAA7449886B455482B897EBB.description: Explain the purpose of ventilation in a confined environment.

1086E9C5D59E4AF0B761952B62271693.description: Apply accident prevention principles and techniques, and discuss appropriate actions in case of an injury or accident, such as whom to contact, fire extinguisher locations, emergency exit routes and first-aid procedures.

C548EECCA7B5473F98A5FAAD8F78D4EB.description: Identify personal protective equipment (PPE) such as eyewear, clothing, footwear and ear wear that may be needed for the work site, school or home

BE1A256044914811AD701223997F5A77.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in the work area.
